newsitem.title: GERMANY: Buba's Issing says forex shifts possible pre-Euro.
newsitem.headline: Buba's Issing says forex shifts possible pre-Euro.

text.p: Bundesbank chief economist Otmar Issing said on Monday that one of the possible effects of the approach of the single currency union was a shift out of the deutschemark into dollar-denominated investments.
Issing told a bankers' forum that uncertainty about the Euro's stability might prompt some shifting of assets, but said other scenarios were also possible.

"On the one hand, shifts out of mark deposits into dollar investments are possible - many believe this will apply particularly to the introduction phase, when the reputation of the Euro is still being built up," Issing said.

However, Issing added that the launch of the Euro might reduce the worldwide demand for foreign currency holdings, which would in particular affect the dollar, often held to offset risks from individual European countries.

"The net effect of these various occurences cannot be determined in advance. To that extent it must remain open whether the other reserve currencies will benefit from the introduction of the Euro or not," he said.
